meanings.definition: A porous, absorbent pad used for cleaning or applying liquid
meanings.sent1: I used a sponge to clean the dishes after dinner.
meanings.sent2: The kitchen sponge soaked up all the spilled juice.
meanings.sent3: The sponge happily absorbed the soapy water and bubbles.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a sponge, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's ability to soak up water amazed the children.

meanings.definition: A person who takes advantage of the generosity of others
meanings.sent1: He's known as a sponge because he always asks for favors but never gives back.
meanings.sent2: Beware of sponges who try to manipulate your kindness for their benefit.
meanings.sent3: The sponge at the office potluck took more than their fair share of food.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a sponge, absorbing all the compliments without reciprocating.
meanings.sent5: The sponge's constant borrowing without returning made everyone wary.

meanings.definition: A type of aquatic animal with a soft, porous body
meanings.sent1: The sponge in the ocean provides shelter for small fish.
meanings.sent2: The marine biologist studied the unique features of the sea sponge.
meanings.sent3: The sponge's gentle movements in the water were mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The sponge's ability to filter water is crucial for the ecosystem.
meanings.sent5: The colorful sponge added beauty to the underwater world.

meanings.definition: To absorb or soak up liquid
meanings.sent1: The dry soil began to sponge up the rainwater quickly.
meanings.sent2: She used a towel to sponge up the spilled milk from the floor.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty plants eagerly sponged up the water after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The desert sand seemed to sponge up the sweat from his forehead.
meanings.sent5: The paper towel was able to sponge up the coffee spill in no time.

meanings.definition: To clean or wipe with a sponge
meanings.sent1: She would sponge the kitchen counter every evening after cooking.
meanings.sent2: He decided to sponge the car to remove the dust and dirt.
meanings.sent3: The maid would sponge the windows until they sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The artist gently sponged the canvas to create a textured effect.
meanings.sent5: The child loved to sponge the walls with soapy water during spring cleaning.
